control
Class SharedSocket

java.lang.Object
  control.SharedSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SharedSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class maps the data of the device events and codifies it under the GSON/JSON protocol before sending it to the specified IP address (and port) through a socket.

Author:
Santiago Hors Fraile

Constructor Detail

SharedSocket

public SharedSocket()
Method Detail

getSharedSocket

public static SharedSocket getSharedSocket()
Returns a new instance of SharedOutupu if it did not exist or the instance that was created if there was a created instance already. It starts the thread to listen to the port inputs.

Returns:
SharedSocket

performTransference

public void performTransference(IEventCommModule se)
This function sends any type of data device data event through the socket. It is mapped and codified under the GSON/JSON protocol before it is sent. It is mandatory to get any message from the other side of the socket each time that we are going to send data.

Parameters:
se - The device data event (of any type) that we want to send information about.

receiveInstructions

public void receiveInstructions()
This function catches the information received from the socket and creates/removes launchers depending on the request. This function also listens to the 'continue' message that the node sends indicating that is ready to be sent new data.

run

public void run()
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
